g.text: two distinct peaks in the spectra of organic materials centered at 1610 and 1630 cm
represents the integrated peak intensity of the aromatic C
signals are due to aliphatic C
H bending. C-factor represents the intensity ratio of
the oxygenated versus aromatic functional groups. A-factor is the intensity ratio of
aliphatic/ (aliphatic + aromatic) bands. A-factor is calculated slightly different from
. The integrated peak area under 1450 cm
the area under 2857 and 2925 as the aliphatic absorption bands. This is because the
pulsed optical parametric oscillator (OPO) laser used in the nano-IR instrument
has two distinct stages. The laser spot size and focus is different in the different
stages, thus it is difﬁcult to compute quantitative IR ratios using intensity values
. The data that support the ﬁndings of this study are available
from the authors on reasonable request (see author contributions for speciﬁc data
